title: Peru Two drug mule was stripped naked and told she'd 'never see daylight again'
text:

'Peru Two' drug mule Michaella McCollum was handcuffed, stripped naked and told she'd "never see daylight again" after her arrest for smuggling £1.5million of cocaine.

The Northern Irish ex-convict served more than two years in the maximum security prison after she and pal Melissa Reid were caught in the airport at the capital city of Lima in 2013.

She described how she was forced to strip naked and woke to find 40 or 50 cockroaches crawling above her head and around her feet.

And the bathroom area of her prison was a pit with a small jug next to it.

She was told: "If you wanted a shower you used the jug to pour water over yourself.

(Image: REUTERS)

(Image: Michaella McCollum/Instagram)

"When you used the hole as a toilet, you used the jug to wash it away."

After she was also told to keep hydrated by drinking the water in the jug, she replied: "You're kidding me? We can't drink that! It's filthy! And there's hardly any of it."

The 25-year-old, now a mum-of-two, suggested to Melissa that they would have to learn Spanish and understand the rules, the Mail on Sunday reports.

(Image: REUTERS)

The pair even talked to a fellow inmate who shared her story of how she murdered her boyfriend's girlfriend and a baby then served the infant in a stew.

Michaella's case was fast-tracked in 2013 after she learned that she had brought a lot of 'unwanted attention' to Peru's legal system.

A guilty plead gave McCollum and Reid an exchange for six years and eight months rather than the 15-year stretch she had feared.

(Image: Michaella McCollum/Instagram)

In her book You'll Never See Daylight Again, which is published at the end of the month, McCollum recounts how she got involved in smuggling as a 20-year-old.

She said she even took the opportunity to run a prisoner's beauty salon in a bid to prove her trustworthiness.

McCollum was released on March 31 2016, and returned to Ireland in August that year.

She is set to profit from sales of her tell-all book, and has reportedly held talks about turning it into a TV series.
description: Michaella McCollum said she had to keep herself hydrated by drinking water in a jug next to a toilet pit after being jailed over a £1.5million cocaine smuggling plot
